title: Test cases fail with 'received error for `TcpListener::bind(&addr)`: Cannot assign requested address (os error 99)'

labels.name: A-testsuite
labels.description: Area: The testsuite used to check the correctness of rustc

body:
**python x.py test gives the following error:** 
arch: **ppc64le**
environment: **Ubuntu:16.04 docker container** 
```
Testing panic_unwind stage1 (powerpc64le-unknown-linux-gnu -> powerpc64le-unknown-linux-gnu)
    Finished release [optimized] target(s) in 0.38s
   Doc-tests panic_unwind
error: no global memory allocator found but one is required; link to std or add #[global_allocator] to a static item that implements the GlobalAlloc trait.


running 0 tests

test result: ok. 0 passed; 0 failed; 0 ignored; 0 measured; 0 filtered out

error: test failed, to rerun pass '--lib'


command did not execute successfully: "/rust/build/powerpc64le-unknown-linux-gnu/stage0/bin/cargo" "test" "--target" "powerpc64le-unknown-linux-gnu" "-j" "3" "--release" "--features" "panic-unwind backtrace" "--manifest-path" "/rust/src/libstd/Cargo.toml" "-p" "std" "--" "--quiet"
expected success, got: exit code: 101


failed to run: /rust/build/bootstrap/debug/bootstrap test
Build completed unsuccessfully in 0:28:17
```

Executing the command : 

"/rust/build/powerpc64le-unknown-linux-gnu/stage0/bin/cargo" "test" "--target" "powerpc64le-unknown-linux-gnu" "-j" "3" "--release" "--features" "panic-unwind backtrace" "--manifest-path" "/rust/src/libstd/Cargo.toml" "-p" "std" "--" "--quiet"

Get the following output:
```
error: failed to parse manifest at `/rust/src/tools/miri/Cargo.toml`

Caused by:
  the cargo feature `default-run` requires a nightly version of Cargo, but this is the `stable` channel
```
